N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6173.5 - Program monitoring and evaluation

State Regulations
(a) The division shall monitor and evaluate
the effectiveness of the program services provided by a provider agency
receiving funds pursuant to this Part. (b) The division shall have the right and
authority to review the performance of a provider agency receiving funds
pursuant to this Part. Such review may take the form of site visits, records
inspections, correspondence, telephone communication, or other methods deemed
necessary by the commissioner to ascertain the quality and quantity of provider
agency activities according to its contract. (c) A provider agency that receives funds
pursuant to this Part shall keep books, ledgers, receipts, work records, consultant agreements, and inventory records pertinent to the program services
it provided. All such accounts and documentation shall be kept in generally
accepted fashion and shall be open to review by the division or the State

Comptroller, or both. Notes
